description.zh-cn: 位于东亚的岛屿国家，实行单一制及议会制君主立宪制。其为世界第四大经济体，七大工业国组织成员。
description.en: An island country in East Asia, operating under a unitary parliamentary constitutional monarchy. It is the world's fourth-largest economy and a member of the G7.

description.zh-cn: 日本第126代天皇，于2019年5月1日即位。
description.en: The 126th Emperor of Japan, who ascended to the throne on May 1, 2019.

description.zh-cn: 日本君主的称号，为日本国及国民团结的象征，是名义上的国家元首。
description.en: The title of the monarch of Japan, who is the symbol of the State and of the unity of the people, and is the ceremonial head of state.

description.zh-cn: 日本政治人物，根据文书记载为时任内阁总理大臣。
description.en: A Japanese politician, serving as the Prime Minister according to the document.

description.zh-cn: 日本的政府首脑，由国会提名，天皇任命。
description.en: The head of government of Japan, nominated by the Diet and appointed by the Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 日本传说中的初代天皇，传统上认为其于公元前660年2月11日建国。
description.en: The legendary first Emperor of Japan, traditionally believed to have founded the country on February 11, 660 BC.

description.zh-cn: 日本古代一场重要的政治和社会改革，旨在建立一个以天皇为中心的中央集权国家，仿效了中国隋唐制度。
description.en: A significant political and social reform in ancient Japan aimed at establishing a centralized state with the Emperor at its core, modeled after the Sui and Tang dynasties of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国历史上的一个朝代，其政治制度和文化对古代日本产生了深远影响。
description.en: A dynasty in Chinese history whose political system and culture had a profound influence on ancient Japan.

description.zh-cn: 北美洲的国家。二战后占领日本并主导其宪法制定，现为日本最亲密的盟友。
description.en: A country in North America. It occupied Japan after World War II, led the drafting of its constitution, and is now Japan's closest ally.

description.zh-cn: 位于东亚的国家，与日本存在钓鱼台列屿主权争议，是日本最大的贸易伙伴。
description.en: A country in East Asia, which has a territorial dispute with Japan over the Senkaku/Diaoyu Islands and is Japan's largest trading partner.

description.zh-cn: 位于东亚的国家，与日本存在独岛主权争议。
description.en: A country in East Asia, which has a territorial dispute with Japan over Dokdo/Takeshima.

description.zh-cn: 横跨欧亚大陆的国家，与日本存在南千岛群岛（北方四岛）主权争议。
description.en: A transcontinental country, which has a territorial dispute with Japan over the Southern Kuril Islands (Northern Territories).

description.zh-cn: 从明治维新到第二次世界大战结束期间的日本国号。作为轴心国之一参与了第二次世界大战。
description.en: The official name of Japan from the Meiji Restoration until the end of World War II. It participated in World War II as one of the Axis powers.

description.zh-cn: 全球性的军事冲突，日本作为轴心国一方参与，并最终于1945年投降。
description.en: A global military conflict in which Japan participated as one of the Axis powers, ultimately surrendering in 1945.

description.zh-cn: 日本第124代天皇，在位期间日本参与了第二次世界大战。1945年8月15日，他通过玉音放送宣布日本无条件投降。
description.en: The 124th Emperor of Japan, during whose reign Japan participated in World War II. On August 15, 1945, he announced Japan's unconditional surrender via the Jewel Voice Broadcast.

nodes.id: 同盟国最高司令官总司令部

zh-cn: 同盟国最高司令官总司令部
en: Supreme Commander for the Allied Powers

description.zh-cn: 第二次世界大战后，以美军为主导的同盟国军队在日本设立的军事占领机构，对战后日本进行了全面的社会和政治改造。
description.en: A military occupation authority established in Japan by the Allied Powers, led by the United States, after World War II. It conducted comprehensive social and political reforms in post-war Japan.

description.zh-cn: 日本现行宪法，在同盟国军事占领下制定，确立了主权在民、基本人权的尊重以及和平主义三大原则。
description.en: The current constitution of Japan, enacted during the Allied occupation. It establishes the principles of popular sovereignty, respect for fundamental human rights, and pacifism.

description.zh-cn: 日本在第二次世界大战后成立的实际上的国家武装力量，根据宪法第九条，其任务是维持日本的自我防卫能力。
description.en: The de facto armed forces of Japan established after World War II. According to Article 9 of the Constitution, its mission is to maintain Japan's self-defense capabilities.

description.zh-cn: 日本的国家行政机关，由内阁总理大臣领导。
description.en: The executive branch of the government of Japan, led by the Prime Minister.

description.zh-cn: 日本前内阁总理大臣，2022年7月8日在奈良市参加竞选活动期间遇刺身亡。
description.en: A former Prime Minister of Japan, who was assassinated on July 8, 2022, during a campaign event in Nara.

description.zh-cn: 导致前日本首相安倍晋三死亡的枪击事件。
description.en: The shooting incident that resulted in the death of former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe.

zh-cn: 2011年日本东北地方太平洋近海地震

description.zh-cn: 2011年发生在日本东北部太平洋海域的强烈地震，引发了大规模海啸并导致了福岛第一核电站事故。
description.en: A powerful earthquake that occurred off the Pacific coast of Tōhoku in 2011, triggering a massive tsunami and leading to the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear disaster.

description.zh-cn: 由东日本大震灾引发的严重核事故。
description.en: A severe nuclear accident triggered by the 2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami.

description.zh-cn: 一个全球性的国际组织，日本于1956年加入。
description.en: A global international organization, which Japan joined in 1956.

description.zh-cn: 美国海军准将，率领黑船舰队迫使江户幕府开港通商。
description.en: A Commodore of the United States Navy who commanded the Black Ships fleet that forced the Edo Shogunate to open its ports to trade.

description.zh-cn: 日本历史上最后一个武家政权，由德川家康建立。实行了长达两百多年的锁国政策。
description.en: The last feudal military government of Japan, established by Tokugawa Ieyasu. It implemented a policy of national seclusion for over two hundred years.

description.zh-cn: 江户幕府的开创者，日本战国时代的终结者之一。
description.en: The founder of the Edo shogunate and one of the unifiers of Japan during the Sengoku period.

description.zh-cn: 根据传统，神武天皇于公元前660年2月11日即位并建立日本国。
description.en: According to tradition, Emperor Jimmu ascended to the throne and founded Japan on February 11, 660 BC.

description.zh-cn: 德仁于2019年5月1日即位为日本天皇。
description.en: Naruhito ascended to the throne as the Emperor of Japan on May 1, 2019.

description.zh-cn: 根据Wikitext内容，高市早苗担任内阁总理大臣。
description.en: According to the Wikitext, Sanae Takaichi serves as the Prime Minister.

description.zh-cn: 自卫队是日本的国家防卫力量，由防卫省统辖，最高指挥官为内阁总理大臣。
description.en: The Self-Defense Forces are Japan's national defense force, under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Defense, with the Prime Minister as the commander-in-chief.

description.zh-cn: 大化革新仿效中国唐朝的政治制度，建立了中央集权国家。
description.en: The Taika Reform modeled its political system after the Tang dynasty of China to establish a centralized state.

description.zh-cn: 大日本帝国作为轴心国的主要成员之一，是第二次世界大战在亚太战场的主要侵略方。
description.en: The Empire of Japan, as one of the main members of the Axis powers, was the primary aggressor in the Asia-Pacific theater of World War II.

description.zh-cn: 美国在广岛和长崎投下原子弹，最终迫使大日本帝国投降。
description.en: The United States dropped atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki, ultimately forcing the Empire of Japan to surrender.

description.zh-cn: 昭和天皇通过广播宣布日本无条件投降，标志着第二次世界大战的结束。
description.en: Emperor Shōwa announced Japan's unconditional surrender via radio broadcast, marking the end of World War II.

relationships.source: 同盟国最高司令官总司令部

description.zh-cn: 战后对日本进行军事占领和全面的民主化改造，并主导制定了《日本国宪法》。
description.en: Conducted the post-war military occupation and comprehensive democratic reforms in Japan, and led the drafting of the Constitution of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 日本是美国在国际上最亲密的盟友之一，两国于1960年签署《美日安保条约》。
description.en: Japan is one of the United States' closest international allies; the two countries signed the U.S.-Japan Security Treaty in 1960.

description.zh-cn: 两国之间存在尖阁诸岛/钓鱼台列屿的主权争议。
description.en: There is a sovereignty dispute between the two countries over the Senkaku/Diaoyu Islands.

description.zh-cn: 两国之间存在北方四岛/南千岛群岛的主权争议。
description.en: There is a sovereignty dispute between the two countries over the Northern Territories/Southern Kuril Islands.

description.zh-cn: 两国之间存在竹岛/独岛的主权争议。
description.en: There is a sovereignty dispute between the two countries over Takeshima/Dokdo.

description.zh-cn: 日本于1956年12月18日加入联合国。
description.en: Japan joined the United Nations on December 18, 1956.

description.zh-cn: 东日本大震灾引发的海啸导致了福岛第一核电站的严重事故。
description.en: The tsunami triggered by the Great East Japan Earthquake led to the severe accident at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant.

description.zh-cn: 此次事件导致前首相安倍晋三身亡。
description.en: This event resulted in the death of former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe.

description.zh-cn: 德川家康于1603年开创江户幕府。
description.en: Tokugawa Ieyasu founded the Edo shogunate in 1603.

description.zh-cn: 率领黑船舰队迫使日本开港通商，结束了江户幕府长期的锁国政策。
description.en: Led the fleet of Black Ships to force Japan to open its ports to trade, ending the Edo shogunate's long period of national isolation.
